body: @yiisoft/core-developers I think the same was discussed earlier, but I can not find that issue.

It was partially fixed but since original reporter said it is not needed anymore, it was not finished. 

@bsyomov it is not a priority for us since such schemas are not common. If you want it fixed you have to send us a pull request containing a fix and unulit tests verifying it.

Sorry, but I do not have to waste time on studying creating a pull request for now.

replace
if (!preg_match('/^([\w.]+)(:(\w*))?(:(.*))?$/', $attribute, $matches))
with
if (!preg_match('/^([\w.]+)(:(\w*))?(:(.*))?$/u', $attribute, $matches)) 
works for me. 
And it's not so critical at all, i can just use ['label','value'] notation instead.
But using non-english names in oData, SOAP etc. not so rare.

issue.title: Closes #13243: Added support for unicode attribute names in `yii\widgets\DetailView`

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | no
| New feature?  | yes
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | yes
| Fixed issues  | #13243

Closes #13243 ðŸ”’ :shipit: 

This is already implemented for GridView.
 
I think solution suggested by @bsyomov in https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/13243#issuecomment-268099889 is probably better because it does not allow characters like comma, etc. in attribute name. From the other side, who knows, maybe such special characters can take place in some API's related attributes. Creating black list for them can be a hassle. Anyway I changed regex to be the same as in GridView for consistency.

Ideally, if regex is the same for GridView and DetailView it's better to store it in some common constant. However GridView and DetailView are not directly related with each other, so I left them separate for now.

GridView is pretty poorly tested. Ideally this needs to be tested there too.

issue.title: Attribute name must contain word characters only

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:

In mysql these are valid characters for column names.
